snippet: The state’s gay marriage law is legal, a judge ruled on Thursday, despite a challenge saying voters thought they barred same-sex marriage 15 years ago in the state’s Constitution.
abstract: Circuit Court Judge Karl Sakamoto rules in Hawaii that state's new gay marriage law is legal, despite challenge saying that voters thought they barred same-sex marriage in 1998 amendment to state’s Constitution.
lead_paragraph: The state’s gay marriage law is legal, a judge ruled on Thursday, despite a challenge saying voters thought they barred same-sex marriage 15 years ago in the state’s Constitution.

headline.main: Hawaii: Judge Rejects Challenge to New Same-Sex Marriage Law
headline.print_headline: Hawaii: Judge Rejects Challenge To New Same-Sex Marriage Law

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
